Is there a risk assessment program that has been approved by management, communicated to constituents and an owner to maintain and review the program? if yes, does it include:
Is there a program to manage the treatment of risks identified during assessments?
A formal process for assigning appropriate management ownership for each risk?
A formal process for appropriate management knowingly and objectively accepting risks and approving action plans?
A formal process for tracking the status of action plans and reporting them to management?
SolutionComments: Tracked through the Information Security Commitee meeting minutes

SecurityQuestions: Controls identified for each material risk?
Measures for defining, monitoring, and reporting risk metrics?

Do Subcontractors have access to Scoped Systems and Data? (backup vendors, service providers, equipment support maintenance, software maintenance vendors, data recovery vendors, etc.)? If yes, is there:
A documented vendor management process in place for the selection, oversight and risk assessment of third party vendors? If yes, does it include:
SolutionComments: Prognos does not allow access to PHI to any vendors except AWS for hosting and ClearData as the overlay of security that sits on AWS.  Both companies have HITRUST certifications and have signed BAAs with Prognos.

SecurityQuestions: Approval by management?
SolutionComments: Per SL.9 there is no documented process in place

SecurityQuestions: Annual review?
SolutionComments: Per SL.9 there is no documented process in place

SecurityQuestions: Required reassessment when service delivery or contract changes?
Review of the subcontractor's vendor management policy and procedures?
Is there a process to identify and log subcontractor information security, privacy and/or data breach issues?
Is there a vendor management program?
Do external parties have access to Scoped Systems and Data or processing facilities?
SolutionComments: Prognos does not allow access to PHI to any vendors except AWS for hosting and ClearData as the overlay of security that sits on AWS.  Both companies have HITRUST certifications and have signed BAAs with Prognos.

SecurityQuestions: Is the maturity of IT management processes formally evaluated at least annually using an established benchmark (e.g., COBIT maturity models)?
Are there regular privacy risk assessments conducted? If yes, provide frequency and scope. If no, explain reason.
SolutionComments: Risk assessments are performed anually for all systems that access or store PHI as well as ad hoc upon significant changes to infrastructure or development of new products

SecurityQuestions: Are identified privacy risks and associated mitigation plans formally documented and reviewed by management?
Are reasonable resources (in time and money) allocated to mitigating identified privacy risks?
Is there a compliance risk management system that addresses the quality and accuracy of reported consumer data?
SolutionComments: Prognos does not receive or report on consumer data

SecurityQuestions: Is there a compliance risk management system that addresses the quality of assembling and maintaining the data?
Is there an information security policy that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents and an owner to maintain and review the policy?
Have the policies been reviewed in the last 12 months?
Is there a Assessee information security function responsible for security initiatives?
Is there an asset management policy approved by management, communicated to constituents and an owner to maintain and review?
Is information classified?

Is there a removable media policy or program (CDs, DVDs, tapes, disk drives) that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents, and an owner to maintain and review the policy?
SolutionComments: Yes. use of removable media is prohibited both by policy as well as technically.  The use of removable media or program is technically restricted at the OS level for all devices with acess to PHI

SecurityQuestions: Is Scoped Data sent or received via physical media?
Are encryption tools managed and maintained for Scoped Data? If yes:
Are clients provided with the ability to generate a unique encryption key?
Are clients provided with the ability to rotate their encryption key on a scheduled basis?
Are staff able to access client Scoped Data in an unencrypted state?
Are staff able to access client's encryption keys?
Is data segmentation and separation capability between clients provided?

Does the ability exist to legally demonstrate sufficient data segmentation, in the event of a client subpoena or a forensics incident, so as not to impact other clients data if using resource pooling?
Is there a data classification retention program that identifies the data types that require additional management and governance?

Is there a self-service portal or API call available to clients which provides the ability to place a "Legal hold" on client data which may be subject to a legal action, without impacting other clients data retention or destruction schedules?
SolutionComments: Clients may contact Prognos legal with official legal hold notices

SecurityQuestions: Is there a Human Resource policy approved by management, communicated to constituents and an owner to maintain and review? If yes, does it include:
Security roles and responsibilities?
Background screening?
Employment agreements?
Security awareness training?
Disciplinary process for non-compliance?
Termination or change of status process?
Are background checks performed for Service Provider Contractors and Subcontractors?
Do information security personnel have professional security certifications?
Is there a physical security program?
Are physical security and environmental controls in the data center and office buildings?
SolutionComments: Scoped Data is stored only in the cloud. We leverage AWS and ClearData cloud IaaS platform for virtual instances and they maintain their own physical security poilicies.  While Scoped Data is not stored in our office building, we do maintain physical security policies for the office building

SecurityQuestions: Are visitors permitted in the facility?
Are management approved operating procedures utilized?

Is there an operational change management/change control policy or program that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents and an owner to maintain and review the policy?
Are backups of Scoped Systems and Data performed?
SolutionComments: All Scoped Data is stored using AWS and ClearData.  We rely on S3 redundancy

SecurityQuestions: Are Cloud Services provided? If yes, what service model is provided (select all that apply):
Software as a Service (SaaS)?
Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)?
Private cloud?
Public cloud?

Hybrid cloud?
Is there a client management portal which allows distributed business accounts (business units/departments) to be managed under a single central corporate account?
Are application self service features or an Internet accessible self-service portal available to clients?
Can clients run their own security services within their own cloud environment?
Is there a management approved process to ensure that image snapshots containing Scoped Data are authorized prior to being snapped?
SolutionComments: No ad hoc snapshots are taken. We do take daily backup snapshots which may contain Scoped Data.  These snapshots are pre-approved / authorized by management.  We hold on to backup snapshots for 30 days.

SecurityQuestions: Is there a formal process to ensure clients are notified prior to changes being made which may impact their service? If yes, what is the communication method:
Is there a scheduled maintenance window? If yes, what is the frequency:
SolutionComments: We don't provide a maintenance window because our internal process absorbs any client facing impact.

SecurityQuestions: Is there a scheduled maintenance window which results in client downtime? If yes, what is the downtime:
Is there an online incident response status portal, which outlines planned and unplanned outages? If yes, how long after an unplanned outage is this updated:
Are electronic systems used to transmit, process or store Scoped Systems and Data?
Are individual IDs required for user authentication to applications, operating systems, databases and network devices?
Are passwords used?
Is there a password policy for systems that transmit, process or store Scoped Systems and Data that has been approved by management, communicated to constituents, and enforced on all platforms?
Is remote access permitted?
Is standards based federated ID capability available to clients (e.g., SAML, OpenID)?
Is two factor authentication required to access the production environment containing Scoped Data?
Are staff able to access client Scoped Data? If not, please identify the controls used to prevent this.
Is there a process which allows the client to specifically list who from the provider will have access to their Scoped Systems and Data?
SolutionComments: Lab data providers only have access to the SFTP where they drop data. No other access is permitted. Deliverables are available only directly for the client.

SecurityQuestions: Are applications used to transmit, process or store Scoped Data?
Is a web site supported, hosted or maintained that has access to Scoped Systems and Data?
Are Web Servers used for transmitting, processing or storing Scoped Data? If yes, for all server platforms is/are:
Is HTTPS enabled for all web pages used as part of the scoped service?
SolutionComments: There are no web pages utilized for the Scoped Services

SecurityQuestions: All available high-risk security patches applied and verified at least monthly?
Are third party alert services used to keep up to date with the latest vulnerabilities?
Events relevant to supporting incident investigation regularly reviewed using a specific methodology to uncover potential incidents?
Operating system and application logs relevant to supporting incident investigation protected against modification, deletion, and/or inappropriate access?
Is application development performed?
SolutionComments: While Prognos performs application development.  There is no development within the scope of services offered to client

SecurityQuestions: Is there a secure software development lifecycle policy (including mobile software applications) that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents and an owner to maintain and review the policy?
Is development, test, and staging environment separate from the production environment? If so, how are they segmented:
Is there a formal Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) process?
Are change control procedures required for all changes to the production environment?
Is Scoped Systems and Data ever used in the test, development, or QA environments? If yes, is:
SolutionComments: We do not use data containing PHI in any environment except Production".

SecurityQuestions: Is there a documented change management / change control process? If yes, does it include:
SolutionComments: We do have access to logs for all system-level changes that ClearDATA makes to our PROD servers. And we keep a history of product changes / improvements in JIRA. We also have snapshots of code / data for every major release.

SecurityQuestions: Are compilers, editors or other development tools present in the production environment?
SolutionComments: Our modules do not require a compiler. We do not host any dev tools in production.

SecurityQuestions: Is a secure code review performed at least annually?
SolutionComments: We have automated systems that verify that no one has inserted any malicious code (or recklessly poor code from a security perspective). We perform code reviews routinely as well.

SecurityQuestions: Is each release subject to a full secure code review?
SolutionComments: We use the system/process outlined above.

SecurityQuestions: Are applications analyzed on a regular basis to determine their vulnerability against recent attacks?
Is there a formal development methodology in operation? If yes, which groups does it include?:
SolutionComments: We use a DevOps practice. Only this single group are included.

SecurityQuestions: Are mobile applications that access Scoped Systems and Data developed?
Is there an Incident Management Program that has been approved by management, communicated to constituents and an owner to maintain and review the program? If yes, does the program include:
Privacy Incidents?
Is there a formal Incident Response Plan?
Is there a 24x7x365 staffed phone number available to clients to report security incidents?
SolutionComments: Incidents can be reported 24/7 to a dedicated slack channel.  We also have a third party operated anonymous reporting hotline.

SecurityQuestions: Is there an established Business Resiliency program that has been approved by management and communicated to appropriate constituents?
Has a Business Impact Analysis been conducted?
Is there a formal process focused on identifying and addressing risks of disruptive incidents to the organization?
Are specific response and recovery strategies defined for the prioritized activities?
Are formal business continuity procedures developed and documented?
Has senior management assigned the responsibility for the overall management of the response and recovery efforts?
Is there a periodic (at least annual) review of your Business Resiliency Program?
Are there any dependencies on critical third party service providers?
Is there a formal, documented exercise and testing program in place?
Is there an Influenza Pandemic / Infectious Disease Outbreak Plan?
SolutionComments: Prognos staff all have the capability to work remotely

SecurityQuestions: Is there a specific Recovery Time Objective (RTO)? If yes, what is it?
SolutionComments: The RTO differs based on business function.  Generally the RTO is 48 hours

SecurityQuestions: Are all suppliers of critical hardware, network services and facility services involved in annual continuity and recovery tests?
Are site failover tests performed at least annually?
Do contracts with Critical Service Providers include a penalty or remediation clause for breach of availability and continuity SLAs?
Is there sufficient redundancy capacity to ensure services are not impacted in multi-tenancy environments during peak usage and above?

Is there an internal audit, risk management, or compliance department, or similar management oversight unit with responsibility for assessing, identifying and tracking resolution of outstanding regulatory issues?
SolutionComments: There is not a separate department but there are individuals with responsibility for audit, risk management, and compliance

SecurityQuestions: Are there policies and procedures to ensure compliance with applicable legislative, regulatory and contractual requirements including intellectual property rights on business processes or information technology software products?
Is there a records retention policy covering paper and electronic records, including email in support of applicable regulations, standards and contractual requirements?
Is licensing maintained in all jurisdictions where required?
Is there an documented internal compliance and ethics program to ensure professional ethics and business practices are implemented and maintained?
Are marketing or selling activities conducted directly to Client's customers?
Are there direct interactions with your client's customers?
Are documented policies and procedures maintained for enabling compliance with applicable legal, regulatory, or contractual obligations related to information security requirements?
Is there a documented governance process to identify and assess changes that could significantly affect the system of internal controls for security, confidentiality and availability?

Are accounts opened, transactions initiated or other account initiation activity applying payments, taking payments, transferring funds, etc. through either electronic, telephonic, written or in-person requests made on behalf of your client's?
Are these sites, applications and systems used to also transmit, process or store non-scoped data?
Are all transaction details (such as payment card info and information about the parties conducting transactions) prohibited from being stored in the DMZ?
SolutionComments: Prognos does not conduct transactions on behalf of clients

SecurityQuestions: Does the service provider permit client audits and assessments?
SolutionComments: Upon reasonable notice no more than once per year unless an incident or change in business dictates additional audits and assessments

SecurityQuestions: Are End User Devices (Desktops, Laptops, Tablets, Smartphones) used for transmitting, processing or storing Scoped Data? If yes, for all platforms, are:
SolutionComments: Laptops are used to access Prognos' virtual clean room.

SecurityQuestions: Security configuration standards documented? If yes, are:
SolutionComments: We have security configuration mentioned in the System Integrity Procedure

SecurityQuestions: All available high-risk security patches applied and verified at least monthly on all server platforms?
SolutionComments: Prognos uses a serverless architecture howeever patches applied to all sftp instances are reviewed and audited annualy

SecurityQuestions: Sufficient detail contained in Operating System and application logs to support incident investigation, including successful and failed login attempts and changes to sensitive configuration settings and files?
SolutionComments:
EC2 logs for all the VMs are being monitored collected and stored for the Audit Trail feature including the failed login attempts and changes to sensitive configuration files.
For laptops having cleanroom accesss, OS level logs are not captured however we have implemnte preventive controls using OS Query

SecurityQuestions: Operating system and application logs relevant to supporting incident investigation protected against modification, deletion, and/or inappropriate access?
SolutionComments: All the virtual machine access logs are backed up by cleardata and archived for future auditability

SecurityQuestions: Are constituents allowed to utilize mobile devices within your environment? If yes, which of the following functions are allowed:
View Scoped Data?
Process Scoped Data?
Delete Scoped Data?
Store Scoped Data?
Is there a mobile device management program in place that has been approved by management and communicated to appropriate constituents?
SolutionComments: No mobile devices may access Scoped Data or Scoped Systems

SecurityQuestions: Is there a Mobile Device Management solution in place?
SolutionComments: No mobile devices may access Scoped Data or Scoped Systems

SecurityQuestions: Is there an approved process for IT to off-board mobile devices when a constituent terminates, or requests to on-board a new mobile device? If yes, does it:
SolutionComments: No mobile devices may access Scoped Data or Scoped Systems

SecurityQuestions: Are staff technically prevented from accessing the administrative environment via non-managed private devices? If yes, is it from:
Are there external network connections (Internet, extranet, etc.)?
Security and hardening standards for network devices, including Firewalls, Switches, Routers and Wireless Access Points (baseline configuration, patching, passwords, access control)?
SolutionComments: Multiple layers of hardening standards including IP whitelisting, rigorous access controls, algorithmic determination of bad actors, etc.

SecurityQuestions: Are firewalls used to isolate critical and sensitive systems into network segments separate from network segments with less sensitive systems?
SolutionComments: Prognos leverage AWS serverless architecture and does not have seperate internal company network. All the network devices are managed by Cleardata (HITRUST certified) also the baselining for all the devices is managed by them

SecurityQuestions: Is there a process that requires security approval to allow external networks to connect to the company network, and enforces the least privilege necessary?
Are all available high-risk security patches applied and verified at least monthly?
Are Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems employed in all sensitive network zones and wherever firewalls are enabled?
Are wireless networking devices connected to networks containing scoped systems and data?
Are there controls to prevent one client attempting to compromise another client in a resource pooled environment?

Is Scoped Data transmitted, processed, or stored that can be classified as non-public information (NPI), personally identifiable information (PII), or sensitive customer financial information? If yes, describe and list types of data.
SolutionComments: Prognos receives PII from clients (in the form of a member roster) and uses that PII to request and analyze PHI for delivery to client

SecurityQuestions: Do agreements with third parties who have access or potential access to Scoped Data, address confidentiality, audit, security, and privacy, including but not limited to incident response, ongoing monitoring, data sharing and secure disposal of Scoped Data?
SolutionComments: The only third parties with the capability of accessing data are the vendors that host the data.  AWS and ClearData have entered into contracts, including BAAs with Prognos

SecurityQuestions: Is a business associate contract in place to address obligations for the privacy and security requirements for the services provided?
For Scoped Data, is personal information about individuals transmitted to or received from countries outside the United States? If yes, list the countries.
Is personal information transmitted, processed, stored, or disclosed to or retained by third parties? If yes, describe.
SolutionComments: Data is hosted by AWS (with a security overlay by ClearData)

SecurityQuestions: Are there contractual controls to ensure that personal information transmitted, processed, stored or disclosed to or retained by third parties is limited to defined parameters for access, use and disclosure? If yes, describe. If no, explain reason.
SolutionComments: Third parties hosting data are contractually prohibited from accessing.  Their sole function is hosting

SecurityQuestions: Is personal information accessed, disclosed, processed, transmitted or retained with third parties outside the US? If yes, describe and list the countries.
Is there a documented privacy policy or procedures for the protection of information transmitted, processed, or maintained on behalf of the client?
Are transactions for covered accounts accessed, modified, or processed, including address changes and discrepancies? If yes, describe.
SolutionComments: No transactions are performed on behalf of client

SecurityQuestions: Is there an anti-malware policy or program that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents and an owner to maintain and review the policy?
Prohibition of disabling anti-malware with exceptions requiring Security approval and reenablement as soon as possible.
Is there a vulnerability management policy or program that has been approved by management, communicated to appropriate constituents and an owner assigned to maintain and review the policy?
Are vulnerability scans performed on all internet-facing applications at least monthly and after significant changes?
SolutionComments: There are no internet facing applications

SecurityQuestions: Are vulnerability scans performed against internal networks and systems?
SolutionComments: Prognos does not have an internal network.  All corporate communication occurs through SaaS products. Vulnerability scans are performed on all clean room systems.

SecurityQuestions: Are penetration tests performed?
SolutionComments: Prognos does not have an internal network.  All corporate communication happens through SaaS products.  All production environments are pen tested

SecurityQuestions: Are there processes to manage threat and vulnerability assessment tools and the data they collect?
Are Servers used for transmitting, processing or storing Scoped Data?
SolutionComments: Cleardata (HITRUST Certified) uses sFTP virtual instances to transmit and store scoped data

SecurityQuestions: Are systems and applications patched?
SolutionComments: The systems and applications are patched and are audited monthly for HIPAA compliance

SecurityQuestions: Are default hardened base virtual images applied to virtualized operating systems?
Are Hypervisors used to manage systems used to transmit, process or store Scoped Data?
SolutionComments: We do not have any control over cloud resources at that level.
